*div1 type="summary"* *p*Benjamin Deckerd to Austin, October 31, 1826. Land business.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Winchester */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="10-31-1826">31st Octr 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I am requested by old*person_mentioned* Mr. Thompson*/person_mentioned* to inquire of you the situation of the *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*his *person_mentioned*son */person_mentioned*bought from *person_mentioned*William Pettis*/person_mentioned*, his *person_mentioned*son */person_mentioned*died before he got *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*and the titles to the *location_mentioned*Land */location_mentioned*has been sent to him but they are written in Spanish and we have no one here who can tell any thing about them the Old *person_mentioned*Gentleman */person_mentioned*has administered on his *person_mentioned*sons */person_mentioned*estate and he wants to know in what manner he could convey it should he make sale of it he also wants to know wether the *location_mentioned*Land*/location_mentioned* is in any danger of being forfeited and he also would like to have the deed copyed in the English language if it is not too much trouble and sent on to him. You can if convenient give the above information and direct your letter to me. and you will much oblige*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Benjamin Deckerd*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
